thread.title: Golf news 2025: Daniel Gale wins BMW car with hole-in-one at Australian PGA Championship
thread.title_full: Golf news 2025: Daniel Gale wins BMW car with hole-in-one at Australian PGA Championship

author: Liam O'Loughlin
title: Golf news 2025: Daniel Gale wins BMW car with hole-in-one at Australian PGA Championship
text:
'Get that engine running': Daniel Gale wins brand-new car with hole-in-one at Australian PGA Championship
Daniel Gale had a moment to remember at the Australian PGA Championship and also earned himself a new car in the process.
The 29-year-old Aussie golfer stepped up to the tee for the 11th hole, with the prize for a hole-in-one being a brand-new BMW M5 Touring worth $264,000.
Just as the topic of the prize was brought up when he was hitting the shot, commentator Ali Whitaker admitted it would be difficult for Gale to pull it off.
READ MORE: Stroke of luck for Leishman as ball collides with fan
READ MORE: Keary's alarming concussion test claim after 'horrible' saga
READ MORE: 'Got to go': Healy sharpens axe as McCullum feels the heat
"I'd love to see that go off this weekend - you'll be hard-pressed to find one today though," she said on the Nine broadcast.
Just seconds later, the perfect shot from Gale rolled into the hole as the crowd erupted.
"It's in," Mat Thompson yelled on commentary.
"The BMW M5 Touring will look very nice in the garage. Get that engine running.
"What a shot, an ace for Daniel Gale."
Watch the 2025 Australian PGA Championship live and free on Nine and 9Now.
He celebrated by high-fiving members of his team and a few spectators
Gale's rare feat saw him shoot up the leaderboard as he donned a yellow bucket hat in honour of the late Jarrod Lyle, who died of leukaemia in 2018.
